alert.note: Alert for Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Teton County through 515 PM MDT... At 436 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Choteau, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Farmington, Pishkun Reservoir and Bynum. This includes the following highways... Highway 287 between mile markers 46 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 32 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for north central Montana.
